Welcome to the Kesalul! I-WIL Commit to ReconciliACTION Series Website! Explore the Fall 2024 *Kesalul! I-WIL Commit to ReconciliACTION Mawio’mi and Indigenous Experts Policy Circle Dialogue Series* - a one-semester learning initiative hosted at Acadia University (Wolfville, NS, Canada).

This unique opportunity brought together Indigenous experts from across Canada for a series of engaging public events focused on dialogue, policy, truth and reconciliation. It was led by a team of Acadia University faculty, staff, and partners, including the following: Campus Faculty Lead, Dr. Cynthia J. Alexander; Indigenous Campus Staff Co-Organizer, Darlene Peters Copeland from Glooscap First Nation; and Mi’kmaq Nation Project Partner, Ann Sylliboy, from Mi'kmaw Kina'matnewey.

This website was created to make publicly accessible the knowledge and insights co-created by showcase Acadia University students' work in three Politics courses taught by Dr. C. J. Alexander: *POLS 1303 Law, Politics & Government, POLS 2003 Introduction to Public Policy, and POLS 3103 Human Rights in Northern Canada*, culminating in a final gala presentation held on November 21, 2024.

The ReconciliACTION Series is a celebration of Indigenous knowledge and critical hope, contributes to ongoing efforts toward truth and reconciliation, and honours the spirit of *“Kesalul!”*, which means *“I love you”*.

Join us and say **"Kesalul!"** through **ReconciliACTION Series!**
